thread.title: California storm floods: Mapping the impact across Northern California
thread.title_full: California storm floods: Mapping the impact across Northern California

author: Brock Keeling
title: California storm floods: Mapping the impact across Northern California
text:
The back-to-back  storms that pummeled California since last weekend are part of an  atmospheric river event that has brought major flooding and  damage to parts of Northern California. On Tuesday morning, the National Weather Service issued a flash-flood watch for San Francisco. Up in the North Bay, the Russian River is still at flood stage in Guerneville while the Napa River near St. Helena will most likely flood again.
Highway 101 in Gilroy shut down in both directions late Sunday night due to flooding and, for the first time in over a decade, the Sacramento River has opened its manual water gates in order to prevent flooding in downtown Sacramento.
Below, we've mapped the parts of the Bay Area hit hardest by the floods.
Curbed SF will continue to update this map throughout the storm.
